info.description:
All requests to the Skribble API must be authorized. To obtain an access token, please use the /access/login resource. Then add the access token as a HTTP header like:
Authorization: Bearer <token>
info.title: Skribble API

post.summary: Login to receive an access token.

200.description:
Returns an access token. All API calls are protected by an access token. Every other API call expects to receive an access token inside the 'Authorization' HTTP header with a 'Bearer' prefix.
 Example 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'

406.description: PDF document loading error: the document is either corrupt or encrypted

get.summary: Get meta data of Document with ID {id}.
Get content of Document with ID {id}.
Get page {pageNumber} of Document with ID {id}.

post.summary: Seal a document with a legal entity signature

400.description: The  user doesn't have a valid seal account associated

406.description: PDF document loading error: the document is either corrupt or encrypted
PDF document loading error: the document is either corrupt or encrypted

get.summary: Get meta data of SignatureRequest with ID {id}.

post.summary: Remind open signers of SignatureRequest with ID {id}.
Add signature to SignatureRequest with ID {id}.

delete.summary: Remove signature with SID {sid} from SignatureRequest with ID {id}.

post.summary: Check the assurance level of a person.

200.description: Returns a person's highest assurance level known to Skribble per provider.

get.summary: Get content of Attachment with ID {attachmentId}.

assurance_level.description: A person's assurance level. Valid values are `qualified`, `advanced` or `none`

provider.description: The provider of the identity assurance.

serial_number.description: The serial number of the identity assurance.

signature_request_id.description: Signature request's unique ID on Skribble.

type.description: The type of this callback (SUCCESS, UPDATE, ERROR).

state.description: The status of this callback process (OPEN, COMPLETED, RESIGNATED).

url.description: The called URL of this callback.

attempts.description: The attempts this callback was carried out.

messages.description: Array of error messages in case that the callback failed

owner.description: E-mail address of the object owner.

read_access.description: E-mail addresses with read access to the object.

write_access.description: E-mail addresses with write access to the object.

created_at.description: The time at which the object was created.

updated_at.description: The time at which the object was last changed.

content_type.description: Content type of bytes sent in `content`. Must be used together with `content`.

content.description: Base64 encoded bytes of content. Must be used together with `content_type`. The value is *Write Only*.

content_size.description: Size of `content` in bytes. Will be calculated by the storage system.

content_type.description: Content type of bytes sent in `content`. Currently, only 'application/pdf' is supported. Must be used together with `content`.

content.description: Base64 encoded bytes of document. Must be used together with `content_type`.

file_url.description: Publicly accessible URL for document download. This parameter is incompatible with `content`+`content_type`.

read_access.description: E-mail addresses with read access to the object.

write_access.description: E-mail addresses with write access to the object.

order.description: Order can be used as custom field to implement a custom order functionality. For Skribble signing sequence use 'sequence'.

sequence.description: Sequence in which this signer will sign starting with '1'. If no order is supplied, participants can sign in any order. If the field contains a number, Skribble will enforce an ascending order defined by `sequence` in which the signers sign the document.

notify.description: Send e-mails to notify the signer about this signature request and for all updates to it's state. If set to `false`, no notifications will be sent by Skribble. Default is `true`

visual_signature.description: The visual appearance of the signature

language.description: Language of the email sent to the invitee

message.description: Message sent to the other participants along with this signature request.

content.description: Base64 encoded bytes of document. Must be used together with `content_type`. This parameter is incompatible with `file_url` and `document_id`.

content_type.description: Content type of bytes sent in `content`. Currently, only 'application/pdf' is supported. Must be used together with `content`. This parameter is incompatible with `file_url` and `document_id`.

file_url.description: Publicly accessible URL for document download. This parameter is incompatible with `content`+`content_type` and `document_id`.

document_id.description: Document ID of an existing document on Skribble. This parameter is incompatible with `content`+`content_type` and `file_url`.

legislation.description: Legislation of the signatures for this signature request. Default: ZERTES

quality.description: Minimal quality of the signatures for this signature request. Default: QES

signatures.description: Which signatures should be created within this signature request.

cc_email_addresses.description: CC e-mail addresses notifications are sent to.

callback_success_url.description: Callback-URL which is called on overall success. There are two template variables: SKRIBBLE_DOCUMENT_ID and SKRIBBLE_SIGNATURE_REQUEST_ID. Both are replaced before the callback by with their current values.

callback_error_url.description: Callback-URL which is called in case of an error. There are two template variables: SKRIBBLE_DOCUMENT_ID and SKRIBBLE_SIGNATURE_REQUEST_ID. Both are replaced before the callback by with their current values.

callback_update_url.description: Callback-URL which is called in case of an update. There are two template variables: SKRIBBLE_DOCUMENT_ID and SKRIBBLE_SIGNATURE_REQUEST_ID. Both are replaced before the callback by with their current values.

creator.description: The email of the user you want to impersonate on creating the signature request.

attach_on_success.description: Documents that will be attached additionally to the all-signatures-complete email.

custom.description: Custom field where own/customer settings related to this signature request can be stored for future actions. The field is limited to a maximum of 10000 characters.

write_access.description: Give existing users full write access to this signature request.

parent_id.description: ID of documentâ€™s parent. Will not exist for the original document.

content_type.description: Content type of document. Currently only 'application/pdf' is supported.

page_count.description: Number of pages in the document.

owner.description: E-mail address of the object owner.

read_access.description: E-mail addresses with read access to the object.

write_access.description: E-mail addresses with write access to the object.

created_at.description: The time at which the object was created.

updated_at.description: The time at which the object was last changed.

content_type.description: Content type of bytes sent in `content`. Must be used together with `content`.

content.description: Base64 encoded bytes of content. Must be used together with `content_type`. The value is *Write Only*.

content_size.description: Size of `content` in bytes. Will be calculated by the storage system.

FieldImage.title: FieldImage
FieldImage.description: Defines an image to be used inside a field.

username.description: The username of the users credentials to login.

api-key.description: The API key  of the users credentials to login.

rotation.description: Defines a rotation of the field content. If used in context with a form field, then only the values 0, 90, 180, 270 are legal. Otherwise every value is legal. The rotation is applied counter clockwise.

Position.title: Position
Position.description: A position in the PDF coordinate system.

title.description: Title of the document, can be empty.

visual_signature.description: The visual appearance of the signature.

account_name.description: Account name of the seal contract that should be used.

order.description: Order can be used as custom field to implement a custom order functionality. For Skribble signing sequence use 'sequence'.

sequence.description: Sequence in which this signer will sign starting with '1'. If no order is supplied, participants can sign in any order. If the field contains a number, Skribble will enforce an ascending order defined by `sequence` in which the signers sign the document.

notify.description: Send e-mails to notify the signer about this signature request and for all updates to it's state. If set to `false`, no notifications will be sent by Skribble. Default is `true`

decline_message.example: I declined because of a good reason.
decline_message.description: Decline message from the signature decliner.

signed_at.description: Time at which the signature was given.

signed_legislation.description: Time at which the signature was given.

signed_quality.description: Time at which the signature was given.

last_viewed_at.description: The time at which the document was last opened in Skribble's viewer.

visual_signature.description: The visual appearance of the signature.

id.description: Signature request's unique ID on Skribble.

message.description: Message sent to the other participants along with this signature request.

legislation.description: Legislation of the signatures for this signature request. Default: ZERTES

quality.description: Minimal quality of the signatures for this signature request. Default: QES

signing_url.description: URL on Skribble's platform where authorized users can view and sign the signature request.

status_overall.description: Signature request's status based on all requested signature's individual statuses.

signatures.description: Requested signatures of this signature request.

cc_email_addresses.description: CC e-mail addresses notifications are sent to.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date of this signature request. Date scheduled at this time when automatic deletion will remove the signature request.

attach_on_success.description: Documents that will be attached additionally to the all-signatures-complete email.

callback_success_url.description: Callback-URL which is called on overall success. There are two template variables: SKRIBBLE_DOCUMENT_ID and SKRIBBLE_SIGNATURE_REQUEST_ID. Both are replaced before the callback by with their current values.

attachments.description: File attachments to this signature request

signing_url.description: URL on Skribble's platform where authorized users can view and sign the signature request.

signatures.description: Requested signatures of this signature request.

cc_email_addresses.description: CC e-mail addresses notifications are sent to.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date of this signature request. Date scheduled at this time when automatic deletion will remove the signature request.

attach_on_success.description: Documents that will be attached additionally to the all-signatures-complete email.

callback_success_url.description: Callback-URL which is called on overall success. There are two template variables: SKRIBBLE_DOCUMENT_ID and SKRIBBLE_SIGNATURE_REQUEST_ID. Both are replaced before the callback by with their current values.

callback_error_url.description: Callback-URL which is called in case of an error. There are two template variables: SKRIBBLE_DOCUMENT_ID and SKRIBBLE_SIGNATURE_REQUEST_ID. Both are replaced before the callback by with their current values.

callback_update_url.description: Callback-URL which is called in case of an update. There are two template variables: SKRIBBLE_DOCUMENT_ID and SKRIBBLE_SIGNATURE_REQUEST_ID. Both are replaced before the callback by with their current values.

custom.description: Custom field where own/customer settings related to this signature request can be stored for future actions. The field is limited to a maximum of 10000 characters.

owner.description: E-mail address of the object owner.

attachments.description: File attachments to this signature request

read_access.description: E-mail addresses with read access to the object.

write_access.description: E-mail addresses with write access to the object.

created_at.description: The time at which the object was created.

updated_at.description: The time at which the object was last changed.

language.description: Language code for the resulting no-account-signer

id.description: Signature request's unique ID on Skribble.

title.description: Title of the signature request. Need `UPDATE` right to change.

message.description: Message sent to the other participants along with this signature request. Need `UPDATE` right to change.

legislation.description: Legislation of the signatures for this signature request. Default: ZERTES

quality.description: Minimal quality of the signatures for this signature request. Default: QES

signatures.description: Which signatures should be created within this signature request. Need `MODIFY_SIGNERS` right to change.

cc_email_addresses.description: CC e-mail addresses notifications are sent to. Need `MODIFY_ACCESS` right to change.

callback_success_url.description: Callback-URL which is called on overall success. There are two template variables: SKRIBBLE_DOCUMENT_ID and SKRIBBLE_SIGNATURE_REQUEST_ID. Both are replaced before the callback by with their current values. Need `UPDATE` right to change.

callback_error_url.description: Callback-URL which is called in case of an error. There are two template variables: SKRIBBLE_DOCUMENT_ID and SKRIBBLE_SIGNATURE_REQUEST_ID. Both are replaced before the callback by with their current values. Need `UPDATE` right to change.

callback_update_url.description: Callback-URL which is called in case of an update. There are two template variables: SKRIBBLE_DOCUMENT_ID and SKRIBBLE_SIGNATURE_REQUEST_ID. Both are replaced before the callback by with their current values. Need `UPDATE` right to change.

attach_on_success.description: Documents that will be attached additionally to the all-signatures-complete email.

write_access.description: E-mail addresses with write access to the object. Need `MODIFY_ACCESS` right to change.

UpdateSignatureRequest.title: UpdateSignatureRequest
UpdateSignatureRequest.description: Update an existing `SignatureRequest`. Send only the fields, which shall be updated.

UserSignatureQualityAesMinimal.title: UserSignatureQualityAesMinimal
UserSignatureQualityAesMinimal.description: Best possible quality, but AES at a minimum

form_field.description: Name of the documentâ€™s form field in which the signature is placed. Takes precedence before `position`.

position.description: DEPRECATED since API v2 - Use positions instead. The position in the PDF coordinate system, where a new signature field will be created.

positions.description: List of positions in the PDF coordinate system where the visual signatures will be placed.

image.description: The image to display inside the form field

VisualSignature.title: VisualSignature
VisualSignature.description: Defines the appearance of a signature in a document. If no appearance is defined, the signature will be invisible, which is a valid option.

message.example: The reason for withdrawing the signature.
